title: Arsenal's eight-man managerial shortlist before appointing Unai Emery
text:

Arsenal reportedly had an eight-man shortlist before opting to appoint Unai Emery as their next manager.

The Spaniard has come under-fire in recent weeks as the Gunners struggle to make progress in his second season at the helm.

And The Athletic have now revealed the names on Arsenal's shortlist to replace long-serving boss Arsene Wenger after a thorough process to recruit the Frenchman.

They claim Emery was joined on the final shortlist by former players Mikel Arteta, Thierry Henry and Patrick Vieira as well as Massimiliano Allegri, Jorge Sampaoli, Ralf Rangnick and Julen Lopetegui.

They also claim two former Chelsea bosses, Antonio Conte and Maurizio Sarri, were discussed, as well as British managers Eddie Howe and Brendan Rodgers, but ultimately not pursued.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Arteta is said to be the only contender who was close to being offered the job ahead of Emery, before the club opted against the ex-midfielder due to concerns over his lack of managerial experience after working amongst Pep Guardiola's backroom staff at Manchester City .

At the time of his appointment, there were reports that Emery was not on the original shortlist, with Arteta, Vieira and Allegri considered the early front-runners.

But former Paris Saint-Germain and Sevilla boss Emery was placed onto their radar by an agent after some candidates had already been interviewed and others pulled out of the race.

(Image: Getty Images)

Emery has divided opinions in north London so far, failing to get the club back into the Champions League last year, falling just short after finishing fifth in the Premier League and losing the Europa League final.

The Gunners were beaten 1-0 away at Sheffield United last Monday before a 2-2 draw at home to Crystal Palace on Sunday as they missed the chance to establish themselves in the top four.
description: Arsenal had a number of names on their shortlist before opting to appoint Unai Emery as manager in the summer of 2018
